page.title: 12CHANGES SINCE W.W.2-CONT.
page.content: Mrs. Wheildon continues: "The country people had a battery radio no T.V..They found entertainment from whist drives,dances,and very occasional trips to Stratford by train,plus such events as flower shows,fetes,and Church affairs.There was also the allotments to look after,which provided extra,much needed,vegetables.Things have certainly altered over the years.Houses have been modernized,at least one car per family is a must and many have two or even three.Buses are very infrequent and expensive,and the railway has gone.The railway line is now just a straight track,and has largely become overgrown and almost impassable,and is a haven for wildlife,which is jealously guarded. The cottage pig has gone and the pig killer is no longer seen in winter".
